title: Srimad Bhagavatam - Canto 1 Chapter 1 | Kids Quiz (15Q)

questions.prompt: Who is the very first person that Srimad Bhagavatam prays to in verse 1?
choices: Lord Sri Krishna, son of Vasudeva
questions.feedback: Lord Sri Krishna is the very first person we pray to! He is the Supreme Personality of Godhead who knows everything and created everything.

questions.prompt: How did Brahma, the first created person, learn the Vedic knowledge?
choices: He studied books for many years
He figured it out by himself
Lord Krishna put the knowledge directly into his heart
questions.feedback: Krishna gave the knowledge directly to Brahma's heart! This shows us that real knowledge comes from God, not from guessing or making things up ourselves.

questions.prompt: According to verse 2, what kind of religious activities does Srimad Bhagavatam reject?
choices: Religious activities done for getting money or things we want
questions.feedback: The Bhagavatam teaches pure love for Krishna, not doing religious things just to get money or toys! Real bhakti means loving God without wanting anything in return.

questions.prompt: What happens when we listen carefully to the Bhagavatam with a humble heart?
choices: We become very smart at school
The Supreme Lord becomes established in our heart
questions.feedback: When we listen carefully and humbly, Krishna comes into our heart! This is the most wonderful thing that can happen to us.

questions.prompt: Where did the great sages gather to perform a thousand-year sacrifice?
choices: In the holy forest of Naimisaranya
questions.feedback: They gathered in the holy forest of Naimisaranya! Holy places are special because good things happen there when we hear about Krishna.

questions.prompt: Who is Suta Gosvami, the main speaker in this chapter?
choices: A king who ruled many kingdoms
A learned person who heard from his spiritual masters and can explain the scriptures
A warrior who won many battles
questions.feedback: Suta Gosvami is a wise teacher who learned everything by listening to his gurus! He can teach us because he heard properly from great devotees.

questions.prompt: What special quality did Suta Gosvami have that made his teachers give him so much knowledge?
questions.feedback: Suta was humble and respectful! When we are humble and listen carefully to our teachers, we can learn the most important things.

questions.prompt: What is the main problem with people in Kali-yuga (our current age)?
choices: They have short lives, quarrel a lot, and are always disturbed
They have too much free time
questions.feedback: In Kali-yuga, people have short lives and lots of problems! That's why we need to hear about Krishna—it helps us in this difficult age.

questions.prompt: Why did the sages ask Suta Gosvami to select the essence of all scriptures?
choices: Because there are so many scriptures it would take forever to study them all
questions.feedback: There are so many scriptures! The sages wanted to know the most important part so everyone could understand and be satisfied.

questions.prompt: Just by hearing Krishna's name, what can happen to living beings?
choices: They can be freed from birth and death, even if they say His name without knowing
They get good grades in school
questions.feedback: Krishna's name is so powerful! Even if we say it by accident, it can free us from the cycle of birth and death. His name is that amazing!

questions.prompt: What can great devotees do for people who meet them?
choices: Purify them immediately, even faster than the holy Ganges river
questions.feedback: Great devotees are so pure that just meeting them purifies us right away! They are even more powerful than holy rivers because Krishna is in their hearts.

questions.prompt: Why do we never get tired of hearing Krishna's pastimes?
choices: Because they are just stories like any other
Because they are short and simple
Because those who develop love for Krishna relish hearing about Him at every moment
Because we have nothing else to do
questions.feedback: When we love Krishna, we never get tired of hearing about Him! It's like our favorite thing—we always want more because it makes us so happy!

questions.prompt: The sages assembled in the forest to hear about Krishna because of which age that had begun?
questions.feedback: Kali-yuga, the age of quarrel and confusion, had started! The wise sages knew that hearing about Krishna is the best way to be happy in this difficult time.

questions.prompt: What do the sages call Suta Gosvami in verse 22?
choices: The captain of the ship for those who want to cross the ocean of Kali-yuga
questions.feedback: Suta is like a ship captain helping us cross the dangerous ocean of Kali-yuga! By hearing from him, we can safely reach Krishna.

questions.prompt: Now that Sri Krishna has left this world and gone to His abode, where have the religious principles taken shelter?
choices: In the words of the saintly person who can teach about Krishna
questions.feedback: Religious principles now live in the words of saintly devotees! This teaches us that we must listen to pure devotees to understand Krishna's teachings.
